item.title: Debra add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Dance, when you're broken open. Dance, if you've torn the bandage off. Dance in the middle of the fighting. Dance in your blood. Dance when you're perfectly free." -- Rumi

item.title: Debra add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "The beginning is the word and the end is silence. And in between are all the stories." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Debra add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "She should have done science, not spent all her time with her head in novels. Novels gave you a completely false idea about life, they told lies and they implied there were endings when in reality there were no endings, everything just went on and on and on." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Debra add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "The unread story is not a story; it is little black marks on wood pulp. The reader, reading it, makes it live: a live thing, a story." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Debra add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Debra add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "It is good to have an end to journey toward, but it is the journey that matters in the end." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Debra add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Belief is the wound that knowledge heals." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Debra add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Children know perfectly well that unicorns aren’t real, but they also know that books about unicorns, if they are good books, are true books." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Debra add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Debra add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "Gradually the healing took place, seeming as it always does that it wasn't taking place." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Debra add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Debra add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Debra add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Debra add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Debra add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Debra add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Debra add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Debra add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Debra add a quote by A.S. Byatt
item.description: "Everything is surprising, rightly seen." -- A.S. Byatt

item.title: Debra add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Debra add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Debra add a quote by Nancy Mitford
item.description: "I love children, especially when they cry, for then someone takes them away." -- Nancy Mitford

item.title: Debra add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book. And then there are books like An Imperial Affliction, which you can't tell people about, books so special and rare and yours that advertising your affection feels like betrayal" -- John Green

item.title: Debra add a quote by Isaiah Hankel
item.description: "If your story is not inspiring you, it’s time to change it." -- Isaiah Hankel
